titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory of the Joseph Goebbels papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-02-21T09:39-0800

change.item: Revised after microfilm cabinet review: positives in mf cabinet, master negs to DataSafe, third negative discarded as it was incomplete after Issayas review.
Revised to add incremental material contents list by Jack Shumway.
Revised to update encoding and add unitid.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Joseph Goebbels Papers)//EN" "reg_304.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.unittitle: Joseph Goebbels papers

physdesc.extent: 11 manuscript boxes, 7 microfilm reels, 1 sound tape reel

did.abstract: Diaries, correspondence, academic and fictional writings, school notebooks, personal documents, memoranda and expense accounts, and sound recording of a speech relating to the early life of Joseph Goebbels, and to activities of the Nationalsozialistische deutsche Arbeiter-Partei and of the German government during World War II, especially military and political affairs. Includes diaries from 1925 August 12 to 1926 October 27, from 1942 January 27 to 1943 December 9 (incomplete), and for 1944 October 3; and sound recording of a speech, entitled "Discorso al Campo di Maggio," 1937 September 28. Also includes microfilm and/or photocopies of all original diaries and of other original documents.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Original diaries and other original documents (Boxes 1-7 and Box 8, Folder 5) closed. Microfilm and/or photocopies available for use.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Joseph Goebbels papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1947, with additional materials added through 2013.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: German national socialist leader; minister of public enlightenment and propaganda, 1933 to 1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Diaries, correspondence, academic and fictional writings, school notebooks, personal documents, memoranda and expense accounts, and sound recording of a speech relating to the early life of Joseph Goebbels, and to activities of the Nationalsozialistische deutsche Arbeiter-Partei and of the German government during World War II, especially military and political affairs. Includes diaries from 1925 August 12 to 1926 October 27, from 1942 January 27 to 1943 December 9 (incomplete), and for 1944 October 3; and sound recording of a speech, entitled "Discorso al Campo di Maggio," 1937 September 28. Also includes microfilm and/or photocopies of all original diaries and of other original documents.

did.unittitle: DIARIES (Originals),
Fragments of diaries
Photocopies pages 5 and 6,
Photocopies,
Photocopies,
Photocopy,
Photocopies,
MISCELLANEA,
PHOTOCOPIES
2 items dealing with property tax on Schwanenwerder,
Eyewitness report of Lilli Ernst about police brutality against Goebbels,
2 letters from tax attorney Paul Schueber dealing with income tax problems,
2 letters from August Boch to Goebbels,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: December letter offers a small book outlining the memoirs of the Spanish ambassador in St. Petersburg in the summer of 1914.

did.unittitle: Goebbels letter of condolence to Frau Troost,
Letter of Vereinigte Krankenversicherung Aktiengesellschaft to Goebbels accounting for some dividends,
List of parts of uniform to be worn at the Reichsparteitag,
Letter from Magda Goebbels' secretariat, requesting information from Goebbels' secretariat whether she should accept invitation to Reichsparteitag,
List of clothing donation from various Goebbels households,
Accounts for a Goebbels trip to the Fuehrerhaupt Quartier,
Note from Hinkel (?) reminding Goebbels about the birthdays of various personalities,
Instructions to courier to pick up three guests and a set of motion picture films to be taken out to Lanke,
Letter of Wilhelm Murr, Stuttgart, that he is sending fresh fruits from his commercial farm,
Breakfast invitation from Dr. Lammers,
List of monthly income of Goebbels and list of money given to Mrs. Goebbels,
Draft of letter of congratulations to Goering on his 50th birthday,
Statement and list of furniture and carpets that were moved from Schwanenwerder to Lanke,
List of duties of the reorganised household staff in Lanke,
Attached to previous material, note to Streicher from Goebbels, Christmas,
Exchange of greetings between Goebbels and Rearadmiral von Puttkammer,
Draft and final telegram of congratulations to Fritz Darges on his marriage,
Letter of congratulations to Gustaf Frensen on his 80th birthday,
Exchange of congratulations with Ambassador von Jagow, Budapest,
Draft of telegram of congratulations to Professor Clemens Krauss, Director of State Opera Munich,
Telegram of congratulations (and card noting thanks) to Professor Dr. Heide upon his 50th birthday,
Draft of letter to Wilhelm Schepmann, Head of the SA, congratulating him on his 50th birthday, and Schepmann's reply,
Telegram to Xavier Schwarz congratulating him on his birthday, and Schwarz's reply,
Small file (in Abschrift) dealing with purchases of paintings,
MICROFILM OF DIARIES,
1925 August 12 - 1926 October 27
1942 January 21 - March 12 (pg. 23)
1943 May 25 (p. 26) - November 12 (p. 11)
1943 November 12 (p. 11) - December 9 (p. 26)
SOUND TAPE REEL
Speech, "Discorso al Campo di Maggio,"

Diary,
INCREMENTAL MATERIALS ADDED IN 2013
Corrected typescript of novel "Michael Voorman,"
Notebooks, report cards, and other school-related materials,
Diary, poems, college study book, "History of Art in the 19th Century,"
College study book, seminary, Freiburg, "Introduction to Philosophy,"
Diary, college study book, signed multiple times Joseph Goebbels,
College study book, signed twice Joseph Goebbels and multiple times Anka Stalherm in Goebbels' handwriting, Bonn/Freiburg; Goethe's Faust, psychology, history, "Monologue of Judas Iscariot,"
College study book, poems, Freiburg,
College study book, multiple poems, signed multiple times, Wuerzburg, winter semester,
College study book, Heidelberg, winter semester,
High school note book, letter to his teacher regarding the loss of his sister Elisabeth, short essay or diary entry (?) signed multiple times,
Journal; study book; "Wilhelm Raabe" essay; poems, signed multiple times, including "Munich, Christmas 1918, Dr. Joseph Goebbels,"
High school study book, German, Rheydt, "utraque fortuna" school essay with the grade "gut,"
Disbound essay, "Theodor Storm the Poet, for his 100. Birthday," signed "P. Joseph Goebbels,"
Dissertation, faculty of philosophy, Heidelberg University, "Whilhelm v. Schuetz as Dramatist, History of the Romantic Drama," signed "Paul Joseph Goebbels" Rheydt,
Disbound, "Study of Goethe,"
High school study book, algebra, signed multiple times,
Disbound narrative, "Those Who Love the Sun" (Die die Sonne lieben),
Disbound book, Sowing (Die Saat), play in three acts,
Disbound notes, poem, shorthand notes,
Notebook, "The Mother's Prayer" (Der Mutter Gebet - Ein Idyll aus dem Kriege), signed multiple times,
Journal, lecture, "Extracts from German Contemporary Literature" (Ausschnitte aus der deutschen Literatur der Gegenwart, Moderne Tierpoeten),
Journal, drama, "Struggle of the Working Class" (Kampf der Arbeiterklasse),
Journal, "Political Diary" (Politisches Tagebuch),
Journal, novel, Gypsy Blood (Zigeunerblut), signed "P. J. Goebbels stud. germ. Bonn,"
Journal, poem, love letters, signed multiple times, Rheydt,
Disbound journal, study book, Goethe, history, poems, school schedule,
Journal, small vocabulary study book, poems "November Afternoon" (Novembernachmittag), "Distress" (Die Not),
Journal, novel, Michael Voormann: A Man's Fate in the Pages of a Diary "I dedicate this in memory of my friend Richard Flisges," handwritten original manuscript,
Journal, novel, Michael Voormann's Teenage Years, III. Part (Michael Voormann Jugendjahre III. Teil),
Journal, drama, Heinrich Kaempfert, a drama in three acts,
Disbound, mostly poems, some notes,
20 letters to Goebbels,
9 letters; 2 cards, Lene Krage to Goebbels, 42pp.; 1 envelope with 2 notes; 45 letters, mostly from Werl, from multiple persons to Goebbels, i.e. Agnes Koelsch, Liesel,
24 letters from Theo Gutmann to Goebbels,
Family correspondence, 18 letters from father, 3 letters from brother Hans, 2 letters from sister Maria, 1 postcard, signed "D.M." including greetings from father and others,
Diverse documents,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Baptismal certificate for brother Hans Goebbels; vaccination card, sister Maria Goebbels; death notice, Hans Prang, Rheydt; 5 telegrams to Joseph Goebbels; 1 telegram to Hans Goebbels; letter from Albertus-Magnus-Verein to Joseph Goebbels; letter from Westdeutsche Landeszeitung to Joseph Goebbels; annual report, Albertus-Magnus-Verein; receipt over 700 Mark for Joseph Goebbels, Rheydt; legal document regarding a property sale between Mr. Clegg and Mr. Oehmen; school essay, Joseph Goebbels; publishing contract between Joseph Goebbels and Xenien-Verlag, Leipzig.

did.unittitle: 22 Fielpost letters to Goebbels,
41 letters from different people, including Hubert Hompsch, Willy Zilles, Liesel, Agnes, Voss, Theo Gutmann,
6 letters from Olgi Esenwein to Goebbels,
26 letters from Richard Fliesges to Goebbels,
Disbound, handwritten observations, poems, notes, essays, including "Farewell to Bonn,"
Printed matter,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Newspaper, Koelner Tageblatt, Saturday, June 23, 1923; student information flyer about war bonds, folio, 4pp.; newspaper clipping, "The Cause of the Buehnevolksbund" (Buehnenvolksbund was the sponsor of touring theater companies that performed in a national and Christian spirit), article written by Dr. Goebbels, Rheydt.

did.unittitle: Disbound, partial school essay,
Diverse documents,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 3 small envelopes, two containing hair from Anka Stalherm; 115 letters, 324 pp., 2 postcards, correspondence between Goebbels and Anka Stalherm, beginning February 4, 1918, last dated letter October 15, 1920; 7 various letters to and from Goebbels.

did.unittitle: One envelope, "Anka" to "Ulex," containing several small clipped notes, a clipped invoice from a hospital,
Booklet, "The Berghof Before Its Destruction," 14 interior black and white photographs of Adolf Hitler's Berghof at Obersalzberg, 3.5" x 2.5", Verlag M. Bauer, Munich,
